z-test for proportions where successes are less than 10

I have this data; Success_amount Overall Attempts p_val_vector actual_estimate average_of_averages 1 0 398 0.999999999999999555911 0.0000000000 0.000841582 2 0 2205 0.319438680275828945643 0.0000000000 0.000841582 3 2 2504 0.999999999999999444888 0.0007987220 0.000841582 4 0 964 0.729535320742549231454 0.0000000000 0.000841582 5 0 1878 0.389887834976935909737 0.0000000000 0.000841582 6 0 2731 0.235335691267788527092 0.0000000000 0.000841582 7 0 757 0.863585487176445232294 0.0000000000 0.000841582 8 1 1524 0.999999999999998334665 0.0006561680 0.000841582 9 0 653 0.946683132537777138893 0.0000000000 0.000841582 10 0 413 0.999999999999999555911 0.0000000000 0.000841582 11 2 4430 0.524540057046991803347 0.0004514673 0.000841582 12 1 1054 0.999999999999998334665 0.0009487666 0.000841582 13 1 5649 0.135419686936719879666 0.0001770225 0.000841582 14 2 2773 0.999999999999997224442 0.0007212405 0.000841582 15 2 4655 0.473681382265657702213 0.0004296455 0.000841582 16 0 4010 0.117458553719864675080 0.0000000000 0.000841582 17 3 1522 0.281197454268709789993 0.0019710907 0.000841582 18 3 4466 0.893879853875587437884 0.0006717421 0.000841582 19 2 2546 0.999999999999998001599 0.0007855460 0.000841582 20 4 8442 0.328274863246539705397 0.0004738214 0.000841582 21 6 5412 0.657656158839843296704 0.0011086475 0.000841582 22 11 6286 0.023448224200527497535 0.0017499205 0.000841582 23 9 4837 0.028075226130280673403 0.0018606574 0.000841582 24 2 1260 0.669317879528037451564 0.0015873016 0.000841582 25 3 2968 0.998896576473299102616 0.0010107817 0.000841582 26 11 5307 0.004286833752223900666 0.0020727341 0.000841582 27 1 570 0.976609779523636478693 0.0017543860 0.000841582 28 20 4614 0.000000000000002217841 0.0043346337 0.000841582 And I'm conducting a z-test as follows: for(i in 1:length(Success_amount)){ prop Each row refers to a different person. I have two questions: Firstly, how do I treat values with high pvals, some of them almost 1? I assume it is due to the low amount of successes and not many attempts, but, for example it seems logical to me that #16 would have a low p value - he has a lot of attempts. It seems to me it is a result of me mis handling my data, but I'm unsure. Is there perhaps a different test I should be conducting to fit this data? Thanks.
